intro: Dendranthema potentilloides, commonly known as the English daisy, is a flowering plant in the Asteraceae family. It is native to Europe and is characterized by its white petals with a yellow center, resembling a daisy. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and wildflower meadows. Its blooms are often used in floral arrangements and have historical uses in herbal medicine.
